metadata.synopsis: A Zhentarim trader from the goblin camp. Roah will react based on your actions if you've met her, or give a brief summary of the Zhentarim's connection to the Absolute if not.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Approach Roah Moonglow on the ground floor of Moonrise Towers. teleport S_Gob_Quartermaster

62.speaker: Player
62.text: I've seen your sigil on cargo at the docks. The Zhentarim have joined the Absolute?

20.speaker: Roah Moonglow
20.text: Ah, a new face come to bask in the light of the Absolute. How can I be of service, True Soul?

10.speaker: Player
10.text: 'New face'? We've met before - at the goblin camp.

48.speaker: Roah Moonglow
48.text: ...of course! Just before some godless lunatic purged the place of every innocent soul.

18.speaker: Roah Moonglow
18.text: A pity neither of us saw what happened.

68.speaker: Player
68.text: I've seen the docks. The Zhentarim have joined the Absolute?

26.speaker: Player
26.text: Careful. That sounds like an accusation.

27.speaker: Roah Moonglow
27.text: The guilty ear hears blame in every breath. But you're among friends here, True Soul.

87.speaker: Roah Moonglow
87.text: Look around. All manner of beasties united against the enemies of the Absolute.

66.speaker: Roah Moonglow
66.text: Quite a god to bring them all together. And quite a fool who'd draw their ire, hm?

65.speaker: Player
65.text: You almost sound concerned for my safety.

71.speaker: Roah Moonglow
71.text: More concerned that your business might be bad for my business.

74.speaker: Roah Moonglow
74.text: So don't go kicking the hive while there's still some honey to be had.

23.speaker: Player
23.text: Drop the act. What are you actually doing here?

29.speaker: Roah Moonglow
29.text: I'm not the one putting on an act, True Soul.  Though I'd mind how well you mouth your prayers.

6.speaker: Roah Moonglow
6.text: Spend enough time in this place, and you might just start to believe them.

16.speaker: Roah Moonglow
16.text: But look at me preaching, and when I'm only here to serve. Anything to trade, True Soul?

84.speaker: Player
84.text: You were rather quick to find your faith.

35.speaker: Roah Moonglow
35.text: All who pass through here find their way to the Absolute, one way or another.

92.speaker: Roah Moonglow
92.text: How painful the path is - well, that's up to them.

54.speaker: Player
54.text: Indeed. Can I see your wares?

38.speaker: Player
38.text: Really? You saw nothing at all?

93.speaker: Roah Moonglow
93.text: Nothing worth repeating. Corpses don't much go in for commerce. Here, though?

64.speaker: Player
64.text: Speak for yourself. I had a pretty good view of the slaughter.

89.speaker: Roah Moonglow
89.text: Better to keep that quiet, unless you want another look from the receiving end.

53.speaker: Player
53.text: I would hardly call the goblins there 'innocents'.

95.speaker: Roah Moonglow
95.text: They were a little more frothing-at-the-mouth than faithful, true enough. Here, though?

57.speaker: Roah Moonglow
57.text: Ah yes - around the time of Minthara's ill-fated expedition to the grove.

9.speaker: Roah Moonglow
9.text: Such a pity there were no survivors to tell what truly happened there.

56.speaker: Player
56.text: If they failed, it was because their faith was weak.

4.speaker: Player
4.text: I actually had a pretty good view of the slaughter.

51.speaker: Roah Moonglow
51.text: Ah, yes. The one who saved us from the infidels in the grove.

36.speaker: Roah Moonglow
36.text: Can't say I've ever drawn steel on children. Suppose I'm not True Soul material.

80.speaker: Player
80.text: Spare me. I saw the docks - the Zhentarim have joined the cult.

81.speaker: Player
81.text: You didn't strike me as the bleeding heart type.

90.speaker: Roah Moonglow
90.text: Oh, I'm sure they deserved it. I'm all for people getting what they deserve.

31.speaker: Roah Moonglow
31.text: For now, I'll settle for getting you what you need. Anything to trade?

46.speaker: Player
46.text: Stick to trading, then. Show me your wares.

73.speaker: Roah Moonglow
73.text: So we did. And it seems we both have a nose for where the real power lies - I've come to pay proper respect.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: Are you a follower of the Absolute?

5.speaker: Roah Moonglow
5.text: Blessed by association, let's say. I come to pay proper respect to a new power.

33.speaker: Narrator
33.text: *The Zhentarim - a network of merchants and mercenaries known for deep coffers and shallow scruples.*

52.speaker: Roah Moonglow
52.text: I'd bow, but the Zhentarim prefer to look their business partners in the eye.

79.speaker: Player
79.text: So the Zhentarim have allied themselves with the Absolute?

63.speaker: Roah Moonglow
63.text: Waukeen's clipped coins, no. Faith is an over-flooded market. Transport, however -

76.speaker: Roah Moonglow
76.text: These faithful folk need some goods moved into the city. Our ships are obliging - quietly.

97.speaker: Player
97.text: You're helping the cult expand for a payout. You're disgusting.

28.speaker: Roah Moonglow
28.text: You know, you sound less and less like a true believer with every word.

44.speaker: Roah Moonglow
44.text: But what would I know of faith? I cater to more earthly needs. Better we focus on that, hm?

32.speaker: Roah Moonglow
32.text: Oh, True Soul, I couldn't burden your spirit with such material concerns. But I'm always happy to trade.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: You're a fool if you think this lot have any loyalty. They'll turn on you in a second.

86.speaker: Roah Moonglow
86.text: Merchants like any other. Though we tend to see opportunity where others don't.

67.speaker: Player
67.text: What business do mercenaries have with a cult?

70.speaker: Roah Moonglow
70.text: Oh come now - we're far more than just soldiers for hire. Have a bit more imagination.

19.speaker: Player
19.text: Lock eyes with the Zhent and gesture in Thieves' Cant: Discount?

47.speaker: Roah Moonglow
47.text: For another in the business? Don't see why not. We can certainly afford it - business is booming.

88.speaker: Roah Moonglow
88.text: These faithful folk don't ask for much - just some cargo moved to the city. But my goodness do they pay generously.

45.speaker: Player
45.text: Do you have anything to trade?
